body_html: @dimamillion Yeah, I had the same problem. Apparently, when you run the code from a main function, pyplot behaves a little differently. You have to actively force it to show, by adding the show command: plt.show() . I didn't need this when running it from a python console, but do when running the file as a whole.
body_text: @dimamillion Yeah, I had the same problem. Apparently, when you run the code from a main function, pyplot behaves a little differently. You have to actively force it to show, by adding the show command: plt.show() . I didn't need this when running it from a python console, but do when running the file as a whole.
body: @dimamillion Yeah, I had the same problem. Apparently, when you run the code from a main function, pyplot behaves a little differently. You have to actively force it to show, by adding the show command: plt.show() . I didn't need this when running it from a python console, but do when running the file as a whole.
